alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 5:40AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Narrow band of heavy rain and strong windshift will impact portions of Fairfield, northwestern New Haven, Hudson, Passaic, Union, Bergen, Essex, Orange, Queens, Putnam, Richmond, Bronx, Kings, Rockland, Westchester, New York (Manhattan) and Nassau Counties through 715 AM EST... At 537 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a northeast to southwest oriented narrow line of heavy rainfall and a strong windshift entering northwestern New Jersey and Orange County NY. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could knock down tree limbs and a few trees and powerlines, and will blow around unsecured objects. Narrow band of heavy rain and strong windshift will be near... West Milford around 600 AM EST. Ringwood and Bloomingdale around 605 AM EST. Wayne and Pompton Lakes around 610 AM EST. Ramsey around 615 AM EST. Paterson and Ridgewood around 620 AM EST. Hackensack and Paramus around 625 AM EST. Bergenfield and Tappan around 630 AM EST. Nyack and Riverdale around 635 AM EST. Yonkers and Tarrytown around 640 AM EST. New Rochelle and White Plains around 645 AM EST. Port Chester and Rye around 650 AM EST. Glen Cove around 655 AM EST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this line and may lead to minor localized flooding.
